Background: Activist from Kailali (Sudurpaschim); former social-work student and community volunteer[10].
Agenda: Urges Nepali youth to stay politically engaged; calls for accountability on past corruption and fair elections[11].

Background: Youth leader from Parsa (Madhesh Province); public profile scarce.
Biratnagar law student; Gen Z faction leader advocating reform[12].
Agenda: Supports introducing a directly elected executive head (with recall option) in upcoming elections[12][13].

Background: Prominent Gen Z activist (Kathmandu); recently announced a new political party[14].
Agenda: Calls for a directly elected executive and overseas voting rights for Nepalis[15].

Background: 24-year-old student leader who united Gen Z protesters online[16].
Agenda: Demands corruption-free institutions and youth-focused reforms; helped select Sushila Karki as interim PM[16].

Background: 24-year-old youth activist; part of the Gen-Z Movement Alliance.
Agenda: Calls for controlling corruption and greater accountability in government.

Background: 27-year-old youth leader from Siraha; MBA student turned anti-corruption activist.
Agenda: Demands integrity, transparency and anti-corruption reforms in governance.

Background: Gen-Z activist and advocate of inclusive federalism.
Agenda: Insists reforms stay within the constitution; opposes direct election of the prime minister; promotes accountability and inclusion.

Background: Gen-Z activist who aided injured protesters in Kathmandu (background details not found in sources).
Injured Gen-Z protester from Sindhupalchok; shot and hospitalized during the anti-graft protests.
Agenda: Calls for justice and the arrest of those who shot protesters; demands accountability for the killings.

Background: 36-year-old founder of the youth group Hami Nepal; former DJ who organized the protests via Discord.
Agenda: Advocates transparency and people’s power; vows to bring corrupt leaders to justice.

Background: 24-year-old cafe owner; Gen-Z volunteer and protest organizer.
Agenda: Demands judicial independence and upholding the constitution.

Background: Law graduate; Gen-Z activist coordinating Hami Nepal’s online channels.
Agenda: Supports judicial independence and protecting constitutional democracy.

Background: Gen-Z activist; links governance with the economy; calls for stable government and rule of law.
Agenda: Advocates performance-based federalism and transparent, development-oriented governance.

Background: Gen-Z activist; emphasizes that corruption is a systemic problem.
Agenda: Demands depoliticized oversight bodies, stronger audits, and a merit-based civil service.

Background: Gen-Z activist; emphasizes constitutional democracy and rule of law.
Agenda: Advocates upholding the constitution and vigilant citizen oversight.

Background: Gen-Z leader; part of the delegation in talks with Nepal’s president and army.
Agenda: Calls for dissolving parliament while preserving the constitution.
